snippet: After a German envoy said that 1,000 German officials could do the work of 3,000 Greek officials,  Greek protesters  hurled coffee and water at another  German diplomat on Thursday.
abstract: Demonstrators in Salonika, Greece, surround German diplomat Wolfgang Hoelscher-Obermaier and throw objects at him in angry protest against what is widely seen as Germany's crippling austerity plan; incident follows comment by Hans-Joachim Fuchtel, German special envoy to Greece, that 1,000 German officials could do work of 3,000 Greek officials.

byline.original: By LIZ ALDERMAN and NICHOLAS KULISH
byline.contributor: Liz Alderman reported from Paris, and Nicholas Kulish from Berlin. Rachel Donadio contributed reporting from Rome.

lead_paragraph: After a German envoy said that 1,000 German officials could do the work of 3,000 Greek officials,  Greek protesters  hurled coffee and water at another  German diplomat on Thursday.

headline.seo: Greeks Pelt German Diplomat in Austerity Protest
headline.main: Greeks Pelt German Diplomat in Austerity Protest
headline.print_headline: Angry Greeks Pelt German Diplomat in Austerity Protest
